Retrieve a Specific Field from Specified or All Staging Levels

Source: R/file-handling_int.R
dot-fh_staging_value_get.Rd

This internal helper function extracts a user-specified field (e.g., "name", "folder", "description", "compression") from each entry in staging_levels. You can optionally provide .envr (the name of a single staging level) to retrieve the field only from that level.

Usage

.fh_staging_value_get(.key, .envr = NULL, .config = .hl_config_get())

Arguments

.key

A character string specifying the name of the field to retrieve from each staging level entry (e.g., "name" or "folder").

.envr

An optional character string specifying a single staging level name (e.g., "bronze", "silver"). If NULL (default), the function returns values for all staging levels.

.config

A list or environment containing the loaded configuration. Defaults to .hl_config_get(), an internal function assumed to provide the YAML or config object.

Value

A character vector containing the requested field's value for the matching staging levels. If .envr is NULL, this includes all levels. If no staging level matches .envr, the function returns an empty character vector.

Details

The function first accesses staging_levels in the configuration, which should be a list of entries, each containing at least one field named according to .key. It filters the list by .envr (if specified), then uses sapply to extract that field from each matching staging level, returning a character vector of results.

Note: This function assumes the field referenced by .key is a single string. If .key corresponds to a field that is not a single string (e.g., file_types as a vector), you may need to adapt the code to return a list or handle that field differently.

If no staging levels exist, or if a requested field is missing, the function raises an error. If a specified .envr is not found, it returns an empty vector (with a warning).

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
  # Example YAML:
  # staging_levels:
  #   - name: bronze
  #     folder: bronze
  #   - name: silver
  #     folder: silver

  # Get all staging level names:
  stg_names <- .fh_staging_value_get(.key = "name")
  print(stg_names)
  # c("bronze", "silver", "gold", "platinum", ...)

  # Get only the folder for the 'silver' staging:
  silver_folder <- .fh_staging_value_get(.key = "folder", .envr = "silver")
  print(silver_folder)
  # e.g. "silver"
} # }
